Question Text: For U.S. Senate, your ballot includes five names non-party Tom Connors, Green Party Joseph DeMare, Republican Rob Portman, non-party Scott Rupert, Democrat Ted Strickland. At this point who will you vote for or lean toward?
If the general election for U.S. Senate were held today, and the candidates were Ted Strickland for the Democrats and Rob Portman for the Republicans, for whom would you vote?
If the election for U.S. Senate were held today and the candidates were Ted Strickland, the Democrat and Rob Portman, the Republican, who would you be more likely to vote for?
If the election for United States Senator were being held today, and the candidates were Ted Strickland the Democrat and Rob Portman the Republican, for whom would you vote?
The candidates for U.S. Senate are Democrat Ted Strickland and Republican Rob Portman. If the election were today, who would you vote for?
If the election for U.S. Senate was today, would you vote for Rob Portman the Republican, Ted Strickland the Democrat, or some other candidate?
2016 Ohio election for U.S. Senate including those who are undecided yet leaning toward a candidate

If the election for United States Senator were being held today, and the candidates were Ted Strickland the Democrat and Rob Portman the Republican, for whom would you vote? (If undecided) As of today, do you lean more toward Strickland or Portman?
If the candidates for Senate this fall were Republican Rob Portman and Democrat Ted Strickland, who would you vote for?
For U.S. Senate, the candidates are Republican Rob Portman, Democrat Ted Strickland, and Green Party Joseph DeMare. At this point who will you vote for or lean toward?
If the election for United States Senator were being held today, and the candidates were Ted Strickland the Democrat and Rob Portman the Republican, for whom would you vote?
2016 Ohio election for U.S. Senate including those who are undecided yet leaning toward a candidate

Pollster: PPP (D-Americans United for Change/Constitutional Responsibility Project)
